sequences

Class ProteinFastaSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • sequences.FastaSequence
      • sequences.ProteinFastaSequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, MassSequence, Sequence

    public class ProteinFastaSequence
extends FastaSequence
implements MassSequence
    This class is a wrapper to the FastaSequence that uses Amino Acids as the alphabet by default. to amino acid masses.
    Author:
    jung
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description

      Constructor using a customized alphabet.
      ProteinFastaSequence(java.lang.String filepath, java.lang.String alphabet, msutil.AminoAcidSet aaSet)
      Constructor using a customized alphabet.

    • Method Detail

      • getIntegerMass

        public int getIntegerMass(long index)
        Member methods
        Specified by:
        getIntegerMass in interface MassSequence
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the item in which mass we want to know
        Returns:
        the integer mass of the amino acid at the given position, 0 if the position corresponds to a TERMINATOR or unknown amino acid.

      • getIntegerMass

        public int getIntegerMass(long start,
                 long end)
        Description copied from interface: MassSequence
        Calculates the mass of a segment of this sequence.
        Specified by:
        getIntegerMass in interface MassSequence
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the segment (inclusive)
        end - the end of segment (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the integer mass of the given segment. If there are unknown amino acids in the segment, their masses will be treated as 0.

      • hasMass

        public boolean hasMass(long position)
        Description copied from interface: MassSequence
        Checks whether this position can be translated into a mass.
        Specified by:
        hasMass in interface MassSequence
        Parameters:
        position - the position to check
        Returns:
        true if this has a mass, false otherwise.
